body:
I can replicate this problem.

I see, it shouldn't be hard to fix.

Can you give this a go please?

[v1.57.0-beta.5609.22ad1e3be.fix-5498-crypt-no-encrypt](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5498-crypt-no-encrypt/v1.57.0-beta.5609.22ad1e3be.fix-5498-crypt-no-encrypt/) on branch [fix-5498-crypt-no-encrypt](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5498-crypt-no-encrypt) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Works great. Tested with gdrive backend. TYVM!

I think I found another bug after using it for a bit. Files are being uploaded with no file encryption as they should be, but it's taking twice the bandwidth/data transfer to do so.

https://forum.rclone.org/t/double-data-transferred-when-using-chunk-crypt-with-crypt-no-data-encryption-true/26028

Hmm, this is something to do with chunker

I replicated this with this config

```
[onedrive]
type = alias
remote = /tmp/onedrive

[onedrivecrypt]
type = crypt
remote = onedrive:
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
password2 = abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz

[chunkeronedrive]
type = chunker
remote = onedrivecrypt:
chunk_size = 100M
name_format = *.rcc###
meta_format = simplejson
```

And

OK

```
$ rclone --config /tmp/rclone.conf copy -vv /tmp/200M chunkeronedrive:1
2021/08/18 22:38:27 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0-beta.5629.e074adb9a.fix-go1.17" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--config" "/tmp/rclone.conf" "copy" "-vv" "/tmp/200M" "chunkeronedrive:1"]
2021/08/18 22:38:27 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/tmp/200M"
2021/08/18 22:38:27 DEBUG : Using config file from "/tmp/rclone.conf"
2021/08/18 22:38:27 DEBUG : fs cache: adding new entry for parent of "/tmp/200M", "/tmp"
2021/08/18 22:38:27 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "chunkeronedrive:1"
2021/08/18 22:38:27 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "onedrivecrypt:1"
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "onedrive:87cifapt3b8o4lssr0hj3uo95k"
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/tmp/onedrive/87cifapt3b8o4lssr0hj3uo95k"
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "onedrive:87cifapt3b8o4lssr0hj3uo95k" to be canonical "/tmp/onedrive/87cifapt3b8o4lssr0hj3uo95k"
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : fs cache: switching user supplied name "onedrive:87cifapt3b8o4lssr0hj3uo95k" for canonical name "/tmp/onedrive/87cifapt3b8o4lssr0hj3uo95k"
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : Reset feature "ListR"
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : 200M: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : 200M: skip slow MD5 on source file, hashing in-transit
2021/08/18 22:38:28 DEBUG : 200M: md5 = e054f3a01bcfdd85302b5a13f43b7f01 OK
2021/08/18 22:38:29 DEBUG : 200M: md5 = 5f6e7408f1c53c59d3b5c28b9e4abce0 OK
2021/08/18 22:38:29 INFO  : 200M.rcc001_26oqn8: Moved (server-side) to: 200M.rcc001
2021/08/18 22:38:29 INFO  : 200M.rcc002_26oqn8: Moved (server-side) to: 200M.rcc002
2021/08/18 22:38:29 DEBUG : 200M: md5 = d2f79d96ae08076fccf02da2afa25fa9 OK
2021/08/18 22:38:29 INFO  : 200M: Copied (new)
2021/08/18 22:38:29 INFO  : 
Transferred:   	  200.049Mi / 200.049 MiByte, 100%, 141.203 MiByte/s, ETA 0s
Checks:                 2 / 2, 100%
Renamed:                2
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         1.6s

2021/08/18 22:38:29 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
```

And apparently twice as much transfer

```
$ rclone --config /tmp/rclone.conf --crypt-no-data-encryption=true copy -vv /tmp/200M chunkeronedrive:3
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0-beta.5629.e074adb9a.fix-go1.17" starting with parameters ["rclone" "--config" "/tmp/rclone.conf" "--crypt-no-data-encryption=true" "copy" "-vv" "/tmp/200M" "chunkeronedrive:3"]
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/tmp/200M"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : Using config file from "/tmp/rclone.conf"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : fs cache: adding new entry for parent of "/tmp/200M", "/tmp"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "chunkeronedrive:3"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "onedrivecrypt:3"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : onedrivecrypt: detected overridden config - adding "{94O0Q}" suffix to name
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "onedrive:spt9gm3d89qfr2dqdg7dmdskdg"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/tmp/onedrive/spt9gm3d89qfr2dqdg7dmdskdg"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "onedrive:spt9gm3d89qfr2dqdg7dmdskdg" to be canonical "/tmp/onedrive/spt9gm3d89qfr2dqdg7dmdskdg"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : fs cache: switching user supplied name "onedrive:spt9gm3d89qfr2dqdg7dmdskdg" for canonical name "/tmp/onedrive/spt9gm3d89qfr2dqdg7dmdskdg"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "onedrivecrypt:3" to be canonical "onedrivecrypt{94O0Q}:3"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : Reset feature "ListR"
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : 200M: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2021/08/18 22:39:16 DEBUG : 200M: skip slow MD5 on source file, hashing in-transit
2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : 0qlv04lq3nv4eimfb6s95jgkco79brvnpsce5mh47ad39sfltbr0: Copied (new) to: nqvp8n8df8vjatabg8dsshpgmc
2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : 0qlv04lq3nv4eimfb6s95jgkco79brvnpsce5mh47ad39sfltbr0: Deleted
2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : kkqbfupn082nq26cs3buu2pe5hggtdqlh2q4omqvcgucl28kfj0g: Copied (new) to: 8nauk92h1k8lruo3veakc3d6bo
2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : kkqbfupn082nq26cs3buu2pe5hggtdqlh2q4omqvcgucl28kfj0g: Deleted
2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : 200M: Copied (new) to: 4rustda4ibq8mam8nqs8kfnvu4
2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : 
Transferred:   	      400Mi / 400 MiByte, 100%, 0 Byte/s, ETA -
Checks:                 4 / 4, 100%
Deleted:                2 (files), 0 (dirs)
Renamed:                2
Transferred:            3 / 3, 100%
Elapsed time:         1.0s

2021/08/18 22:39:17 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
```

Now I think the major difference is the handling of the chunks. With data encryption we get server side moves

> 2021/08/18 22:38:29 INFO  : 200M.rcc001_26oqn8: Moved (server-side) to: 200M.rcc001
> 2021/08/18 22:38:29 INFO  : 200M.rcc002_26oqn8: Moved (server-side) to: 200M.rcc002

And without we get server side copies

> 2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : 0qlv04lq3nv4eimfb6s95jgkco79brvnpsce5mh47ad39sfltbr0: Copied (new) to: nqvp8n8df8vjatabg8dsshpgmc
> 2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : 0qlv04lq3nv4eimfb6s95jgkco79brvnpsce5mh47ad39sfltbr0: Deleted
> 2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : kkqbfupn082nq26cs3buu2pe5hggtdqlh2q4omqvcgucl28kfj0g: Copied (new) to: 8nauk92h1k8lruo3veakc3d6bo
> 2021/08/18 22:39:17 INFO  : kkqbfupn082nq26cs3buu2pe5hggtdqlh2q4omqvcgucl28kfj0g: Deleted

Server side copies count as data transfer (hence the extra 200M) but aren't really network transfer.

Why chunker behaves like this, I'm not sure - do you have an idea @ivandeex ?

What's happening is most probably a result of Chunker fallbacks masking some lower level error.

1.
All  moves in Chunker are done via [baseMove](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/v1.56.0/backend/chunker/chunker.go#L1854) chaining to [operations.Move](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/v1.56.0/fs/operations/operations.go#L591) which falls back to **server-side copy** if server-side move is unsupported **or fails for some reason**.
Can you check the return code of `your_fs.Move`?

2.
Chunker checks for eligibility of server-side operations if `SameConfig` [here](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/v1.56.0/backend/chunker/chunker.go#L1743) returns OK.
Can you check the return code of `operations.SameConfig` for src/dst on your `crypt` fs?
If the check returns that per-object fs configs are incompatible then chunker will fallback to **full upload through lower backend** (e.g. it probably can encrypt content using new file name as a salt or god knows what, we just know `it's not same`),

3.
If the configs are clearly compatible and underlying operations don't error then a chunker deficiency is possible.
P.S. Since recently chunker provides the `transactions = norename` knob for backends with slow or buggy server-side move. Try it.

> Chunker checks for eligibility of server-side operations if `SameConfig` [here](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/v1.56.0/backend/chunker/chunker.go#L1743) returns OK.
> Can you check the return code of `operations.SameConfig` for src/dst on your `crypt` fs?

If I smash `operations.Move` full of debug, I get this

normal

```
2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : fdst.Features().Move = 0xfe41c0
2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : src.Fs() = Encrypted drive 'onedrivecrypt{ConAo}:', fdst = Encrypted drive 'onedrivecrypt{ConAo}:'
2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : SameConfig(src.Fs(), fdst) = true
2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : (SameRemoteType(src.Fs(), fdst) && fdst.Features().ServerSideAcrossConfigs) = false
2021/08/19 17:07:42 INFO  : 200M.rcc001_3m1f84: Moved (server-side) to: 200M.rcc001

2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : fdst.Features().Move = 0xfe41c0
2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : src.Fs() = Encrypted drive 'onedrivecrypt{ConAo}:', fdst = Encrypted drive 'onedrivecrypt{ConAo}:'
2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : SameConfig(src.Fs(), fdst) = true
2021/08/19 17:07:42 DEBUG : (SameRemoteType(src.Fs(), fdst) && fdst.Features().ServerSideAcrossConfigs) = false
```

no encryption

```
2021/08/19 17:08:38 DEBUG : fdst.Features().Move = 0xfe41c0
2021/08/19 17:08:38 DEBUG : src.Fs() = Local file system at /tmp/onedrive, fdst = Encrypted drive 'onedrivecrypt{94O0Q}:'
2021/08/19 17:08:38 DEBUG : SameConfig(src.Fs(), fdst) = false
2021/08/19 17:08:38 DEBUG : (SameRemoteType(src.Fs(), fdst) && fdst.Features().ServerSideAcrossConfigs) = false

2021/08/19 17:08:39 DEBUG : fdst.Features().Move = 0xfe41c0
2021/08/19 17:08:39 DEBUG : src.Fs() = Local file system at /tmp/onedrive, fdst = Encrypted drive 'onedrivecrypt{94O0Q}:'
2021/08/19 17:08:39 DEBUG : SameConfig(src.Fs(), fdst) = false
2021/08/19 17:08:39 DEBUG : (SameRemoteType(src.Fs(), fdst) && fdst.Features().ServerSideAcrossConfigs) = false
```

So it appears that chunker is trying to move things straight from `local` to `crypt` if no encryption is set

Note that features of both backends are identical

```
$ diff -u <(rclone --config /tmp/rclone.conf backend features chunkeronedrive: --crypt-no-data-encryption=false) <(rclone --config /tmp/rclone.conf backend features chunkeronedrive: --crypt-no-data-encryption=true)
$
```

So why did chunker try to move chunks from local to crypt? Does that mean it created them on local for some reason?

Crypt's support of server-side-move depends on data/name encryption
I discuss it in https://forum.rclone.org/t/couldnt-move-into-backup-dir-corrupted-on-transfer-chunker-crypt-jottacloud/26424/5
The trick is that by generating random IVs on every upload `Crypt` can produce different encrypted representations for the same plain data.
cc @ncw

> no encryption
> 2021/08/19 17:08:38 DEBUG : src.Fs() = Local file system at /tmp/onedrive, fdst = Encrypted drive 'onedrivecrypt{94O0Q}:'
>
> So it appears that chunker is trying to move things straight from local to crypt if no encryption is set

I don't yet have time to reproduce with debugging on, but....

isn't local /tmp/onedrive wrapped by _crypt without data encryption_ equivalent to _local /tmp/onedrive with encrypted file names_ ?

frankly, if I was a super-clever rclone-boy I'd optimize out the upload from local to _local alias with mangled filenames_ into a single local move....

otoh if I was a super-secret rclone-boy then in case when data encryption is on, I would promote even the _move within crypt_ remote into _download+upload_ to have crypt generate new random IV and re-encrypt the file for super-security.

in reality it all depends on how Object.Unwrap and operations.SameConfig interact together.
just a wild guess :)

Original request has been solved
A brand new thread started below https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5498#issuecomment-901451695
I'm gonna update labels as the ticket was in fact converted

issue.title: crypt: return crypt-wrapped object even with no-data-encryption

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

In presence of `no_data_encryption` the Crypt's Put method used to over-optimize
and returned base object. This patch makes it return Crypt-wrapped object now.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #5498

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Confirmed bug in Crypt. Patch in progress.
@ncw Please review
